span: Unlocked in name only – will not update.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2025
review-text: Phone arrived in great physical condition, but the listing was misleading. Although sold as “unlocked,” the phone was stuck on Android 14. Samsung already says this model should be running Android 16, yet the phone claimed it was “up to date” and would not update. After hours of research, I learned it is still controlled by the previous carrier, meaning it will never receive Android updates under normal use. Checking the serial number or IMEI does not warn you about this. Another review mentioned this exact issue and they were 100% right. Fixing this cost me hours of my own time, and shipping was also delayed. If you want a phone that actually updates, buy a true factory-unlocked (U1) model.

span: My phone did not come unlocked
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2026
review-text: The title of the item said it's supposed to be unlocked. I bought it specifically for that reason. Now I'm in another country, and the phone is not working with any service provider. What can I do now?

span: Not sure unlocked means it can be supported by your preferred carrier.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2025
review-text: I purchased this unlocked s24 and it looked perfect.  However it would not support RCS Chat on Google messages for Verizon ("Status: Unsupported"). Pics looked awful and video came in as a grainy pi and audio file.  I spent hours updating and resetting everything imaginable, including going into a Verizon store and then calling Tech coaching.  It could not be resolved, but I am able to trade it in at Verizon for the same phone model by purchasing a protection plan...at least I know it will be compatible with Verizon

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2026
review-text: The refurbished one I got has connectivity issues and in general worse overall performance than S3 had before, should have returned within time frame on that.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2025
review-text: For a cheaper phone it was ok-ish. But I am not sure wjat theu repair screens with, because it seemed super flimsy as it cracked the very next day while putting a case on. No dropping or anything. So just be a bit wary.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2025
review-text: The phone itself was beautiful. In perfect condition. This is surprising since it came shipped in nothing more than a plastic sleeve and a doubled over bubble wrap mailer. This phone was supposed to be unlocked. It was not. I did some investigating and it turned out to be locked to T-Mobile. I tried calling them and they couldn't remove the lock because the account attached to the phone had a balance due. I immediately requested a refund from the seller and mailed the phone back in the original packaging. This is irresponsible of the seller. They are advertising locked phones as unlocked.

span: Good Condition, But Not Fully Unlocked – Frustrating Experience
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2025
review-text: I purchased a refurbished Samsung Galaxy S24, and while it arrived in great condition, there’s a major issue: the phone is not fully unlocked. I keep getting a notification that some features aren’t available because I’m using a non-Verizon SIM card. I reached out to Amazon customer support, and they initially offered a refund without returning the phone, but later changed their stance and now want me to return it and wait a month for a replacement. This has been frustrating. Pros: Phone in good condition Great performance and camera Cons: Not fully unlocked, with issues using a non-Verizon SIM Frustrating customer service experience Would’ve been a great phone if not for the unlocking issue.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2025
review-text: Phone Looks good, but smaller than I thought.. It is unlocked (took a few tries for sim to work), however still shows the AT & T at start up. I CANNOT recieve MMS messages. It still has a issue with DO NOT DISTURB exceptions. I do gig work & only want notifications & sounds from those apps when I am working, yet it keeps muting them...I have checked settings & uninstalled & reinstalled them many times in hopes that would solve the issue....

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2025
review-text: Maybe it was my carrier but when I tried to activate this phone it was carrier locked and the rep on the phone said it was because the phone was still on payment plan, if you are buying this model specifically just be aware of this risk

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2025
review-text: Took about 10 days to arrive. Upon arrival, the phone was in great condition, however the charging port was defective. It didn't hold the charger in place. I returned it the next day and still waiting on my refund.
